description:
Polymixia cf. hollisterae is a species of beardfish that belongs to the family Polymixiidae. Beardfish are small, deep-sea fish found in tropical and subtropical oceans around the world. The "cf." in the species name indicates that this identification is tentative, as it may represent a closely related but distinct species from the described Polymixia hollisterae.

Polymixia cf. hollisterae is typically found at depths ranging from around 300 to 800 meters. It has a distinctive barbel-like appendage under its chin, which is a characteristic feature of the Polymixiidae family. The fish's body is generally elongated and laterally compressed, with large eyes and a small, terminal mouth.

Not much is known about the specific biology and ecology of this particular Polymixia species, as deep-sea fish can be challenging to study. However, beardfish in general are believed to feed on small crustaceans and other prey found in the deep ocean environment. Further research may help to better understand the distribution, habitat preferences, and life history traits of Polymixia cf. hollisterae.
